issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. in the tiapp.xml overview tab, it says that I am not part of the logged in organization even though, I am:

1) Part of the organization (Appcelerator SE) 
2) Logged into studio with that organization as my active org
3) Just created the app inside of studio
fields.summary: Tiapp.xml says i am not part of the organization

comments.body: Hello, Try logging out from studio. Close the studio and relaunch again and log in. See if the error happens. Thanks.
This is still happening for me. I log out and log back in (from studio and CLI) and every time it tells me i am not apart of the organization.

Hello, Try logging in through terminal. 

First, Run 
appc logout -D

Then,
appc login

Regards,
Sharif.

We're seeing this problem with the latest Studio releases (4.7 and 4.7.1) with Pro subscriptions that have multiple seats.

It appears that Studio can get confused/corrupted/whatever and become unable to verify that you belong to an organization.

This has happened to myself (being unable to create Hyperloop projects) and my business partner (getting the "you are not part of the organization" message in tiapp).
Is there something happening with the subscription validation service? 

I ask this because as a Paid user of Titanium, I am extremely upset about having these Paid services & features are unavailable to me and my business partner.
